conclusion: The graph is an x-t graph showing position as a function of time.
The y-axis is labeled as x/t (m/s), suggesting it represents velocity.
In a velocity-time graph, the slope represents acceleration.
Equation of a straight line: v = u + at.
The slope of the line in a velocity-time graph is the acceleration.
At t = 0, x/t = 10 m/s (initial velocity, u).
The line passes through the origin extended backward to t = -2 s, where x/t = 0.
Calculate slope using points (-2, 0) and (0, 10): m = (10 - 0) / (0 - (-2)) = 5 m/s².
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 5 m/s².
